text:
Facing criticism over her stand on the draft Disability Bill, Union Women and Child Welfare Minister Maneka Gandhi on Friday denied making remarks that persons with mental illness could not be given government jobs.

The Women and Child Development Ministry tweeted, “During meeting with Minister of Social Justice, Minister WCD stated that definition of disabilities in the Bill must be clearly [defined] as persons with disability, illness and disease.”

“Clear definition will provide clarity to stakeholders on their entitlement under the proposed 3 per cent job reservation under the Bill ... ,” it added.

“Minister WCD has never commented that persons with mental illness cannot be given jobs in govt. It is clearly misinterpreted.”

Ms. Gandhi, who is part of a ministerial panel to examine the proposed Bill, has been attacked on social media by “the #WeCanWork campaign”. — PTI
title: Maneka denies deriding mentally ill
